texts.definition: The process of adding up all points to players in a phase after gameplay has finished.
markups: <style="Definition">The process of adding up all points to players in a phase after gameplay has finished.</style>

Some games end by a player winning, a player losing, or a draw is reached. Other games have criteria for when game ends and the outcome of all players are first determined then. Such games typically use <style="CurrentLink">End State Scoring</style> in that all points are officially and publicly counted after players' possibility to affect the game state has ended.

<style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Amun-Re">Amun-Re</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Egizia">Egizia</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Lords%20of%20Waterdeep">Lords of Waterdeep</link></style> are all <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Board%20Games">Board Games</link></style> where players have cards with conditional score bonus that are only give out after gameplay finishes. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Agricola">Agricola</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Stone%20Age">Stone Age</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/7%20Wonders">7 Wonders</link></style> is similar but here the cards or tiles that give points are publicly visible. In <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Dominion">Dominion</link></style> the acquisition of victory cards are open but players then need to memorize the distribution of these between the players when a game instance nears its end.

The main requirement of <style="CurrentLink">End State Scoring</style> is to postpone the handing out of at least some points to players <style="Link"><link="scores">Scores</link></style> until gameplay ends. The main design decision regarding <style="CurrentLink">End State Scoring</style> is if people should have <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Imperfect%20Information">Imperfect Information</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Perfect%20Information">Perfect Information</link></style> regarding the game state and how players can get points based on the game state. The former promotes <style="Link"><link="exaggerated-perception-influence">Exaggerated Perception of Influence</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="tension">Tension</link></style> while the latter promotes <style="Link"><link="analysis-paralysis">Analysis Paralysis</link></style>. For this reason, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Imperfect%20Information">Imperfect Information</link></style> seems to be the much more common choice. This is typically at implemented through <style="Link"><link="secret-scoring-mechanisms">Secret Scoring Mechanisms</link></style>.

A typical way of combining <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Imperfect%20Information">Imperfect Information</link></style> and <style="CurrentLink">End State Scoring</style> is to give players <style="Link"><link="asymmetric-goals">Asymmetric Goals</link></style> related to how they score in a game. An example of this is which lord one plays in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Lords%20of%20Waterdeep">Lords of Waterdeep</link></style> since different lords provide different bonus points depending what quests and buildings one has completed.

While <style="CurrentLink">End State Scoring</style> is performed when gameplay ends, this might either be the more permanent end of <style="Link"><link="game-over">Game Over</link></style> or the sometimes temporary end of <style="Link"><link="death-consequences">Death Consequences</link></style>.

<style="CurrentLink">End State Scoring</style> makes it important for gameplay to know their relative positions before the end state as well as what possible points all players can add to their <style="Link"><link="scores">Scores</link></style> during the final scoring. When players cannot calculate the positions for all players before an <style="CurrentLink">End State Scoring</style>, the use of this pattern can provide <style="Link"><link="exaggerated-perception-influence">Exaggerated Perception of Influence</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="tension">Tension</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="uncertainty-outcome">Uncertainty of Outcome</link></style>. If the scoring is at least partly based on <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Imperfect%20Information">Imperfect Information</link></style>, players can be motivated to engage in <style="Link"><link="bluffing">Bluffing</link></style> to make it more difficult for other players to be able and correctly deduce their position before the end state and how much points they can get in the end state. <style="CurrentLink">End State Scoring</style> in general makes <style="Link"><link="beat-leader">Beat the Leader</link></style> more difficult but this becomes even more so when the scoring relies on hidden information (such as <style="Link"><link="secret-scoring-mechanisms">Secret Scoring Mechanisms</link></style>); that it is more difficult to determine leaders in games with <style="CurrentLink">End State Scoring</style> also make it less likely that player begin <style="Link"><link="surrendering">Surrendering</link></style>.

Regardless of if players can accurately or not calculate positions, the presence of <style="CurrentLink">End State Scoring</style> can create <style="Link"><link="analysis-paralysis">Analysis Paralysis</link></style> since players may spend time trying to do so. The presence of <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Perfect%20Information">Perfect Information</link></style> more or less guarantees <style="Link"><link="analysis-paralysis">Analysis Paralysis</link></style> unless it is very easy to determine player positions and possible points to be gotten during the <style="CurrentLink">End State Scoring</style>.

<style="Link"><link="analysis-paralysis">Analysis Paralysis</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="exaggerated-perception-influence">Exaggerated Perception of Influence</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="tension">Tension</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="uncertainty-outcome">Uncertainty of Outcome</link></style>
